Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
GameEngine
public class GameEngine extends Object
Class GameEngine - Creates all rooms, creates the parser and starts the game. It also evaluates and executes the commands that the parser returns. This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game.
Version:
1.0 (Jan 2003) DB edited (2019)
Author:
Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes

  • Method Details

    • setGUI

      public void setGUI(UserInterface pUserInterface)
      Sets the game graphical user interface.
      Parameters:
      pUserInterface - instance of the userInterface class.

    • printWelcome

      private void printWelcome()
      Print out the opening message for the player.

    • createRooms

      private void createRooms()
      Create all the rooms and link their exits together.

    • interpretCommand

      public void interpretCommand(String pCommandLine)
      Given a command, process (that is: execute) the command. If this command ends the game, true is returned, otherwise false is returned.
      Parameters:
      pCommandLine - Command line to be processed.

    • printLocationInfo

      private void printLocationInfo()
      Prints the player's current location and available exits.

    • printInventory

      private void printInventory()
      Prints the player's inventory and its weight.

    • look

      private void look(Command pC)
      Makes the player look around or at a specific item.
      Parameters:
      pC - The command entered by the player, containing an optional second word representing the name of the item to look at.

    • printHelp

      private void printHelp()
      Print out some help information. Here we print some stupid, cryptic message and a list of the command words.

    • goRoom

      private void goRoom(Command pCommand)
      Try to go to one direction. If there is an exit, enter the new room, otherwise print an error message.

    • goBack

      private void goBack()
      Makes the player go back to previous room. Can be used infinitely, until the player is back to the first visited room.

    • use

      public void use(String pItemName)
      When called, the player uses the specified item. Only works if the player wants to use a "usable" item, in the right room.
      Parameters:
      pItemName - The name of the item to be used.

    • winGame

      private void winGame()

    • test

      private void test(String pFileName)
      Executes a series of commands from a specified text file. The commands are read line by line from the file and passed to interpretCommand() for processing.
      Parameters:
      pFileName - The name of the file containing the commands to test. If the file extension is not ".txt", it will be appended automatically.

    • endGame

      private void endGame()
      Ends the game when called.
